results.title: If you are not part of the solution...you are part of the problem
results.creator_credit: Center for Digital Storytelling US, ACMI and Libby Lloyd
results.brief_description: Violence against women is possibly the most important, least examined and most taboo subject in our society. This film explores the beginnings of White Ribbon Day and the campaign to making it an important high profile public awareness day in Australia.
results.title_for_label: If you are not part of the solution…you are part of the problem
results.creator_credit_for_label: Center for Digital Storytelling US, ACMI and Libby Lloyd

results.title: Finding me
results.creator_credit: Center for Digital Storytelling US, ACMI and Joy Chivers
results.brief_description: Through years of domestic violence Joy existed in the silence of the shadows, afraid to cry out, to seek help, to seek support. Broken bones and bruises heal but the emotional scarring lasts a lifetime.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Center for Digital Storytelling US, ACMI and Joy Chivers
results.description: Through years of domestic violence Joy existed in the silence of the shadows, afraid to cry out, to seek help, to seek support. Broken bones and bruises heal but the emotional scarring lasts a lifetime.

results.title: Lesson plan
results.creator_credit: Center for Digital Storytelling US, ACMI and Jeannine le Vaillant-Moffitt
results.brief_description: I have no “me” memories of my childhood aged before 7, but many memories of my siblings. A story of memories, family, love and acceptance.

results.title: Stripped
results.creator_credit: Center for Digital Storytelling US, ACMI and Dinky
results.brief_description: Emotional put-downs can wreak havoc on you as a person, stripping you of your independence, confidence, your mind, dignity and self-respect. It takes a long time to recover and rebuild your life.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Center for Digital Storytelling US, ACMI and Dinky

results.title: Richmond 150 years on
results.brief_description: Inner city Richmond (Victoria) celebrates its 150th birthday. Local residents, shop-keepers, community leaders including Ian “Molly” Meldrum and Peter Norden have their say about their beloved Richmond. Whether born there or a recent newcomer, Richmond it seems, is a place of community, fierce loyalty and respect for your neighbour. Includes some wonderful images of past and present including the MCG, Punt Road, Bridge Road, Swan Street, remains of old factories such as Rosella and archival stills of local street scenes. Narrated by Rob Clancy.

Narrated by Rob Clancy.

results.title: Murray muse
results.creator_credit: Adis Hondo and John R. Hipwell
results.brief_description:
“Murray muse” is a suite of four digital video paintings titled Earth, Fire, Air and Water. The environmental issues affecting the sustainability of one of Australia’s most precious resources, the Murray River and its surrounding ecosystems inform this Digital Video artwork.
This emergent video painting process is a vehicle whereby the consideration of other media forms (photography, painting, printmaking, cinema and television) are remediated, blended and transformed.
The four films in this Digital Video Painting DVD can be played and viewed randomly and continuously, culminating in a symbiotic relationship between sight and sound, editing and postproduction techniques, allowing the viewer to interact with the digital imagery and ambient audio either actively or passively.

results.title: The Man in the irony mask
results.creator_credit: Paul Andrew, Kath Shelper and Scarlett Pictures
results.brief_description: This documentary portrays the life and death of performance artist and AIDS activist, Brenton Heath-Kerr. Through his repertoire of performances, costumes and photographs, Heath-Kerr challenged perceptions, dominant sterotypes and myths which he thought underpinned the gay communities and notions of gay identity. An emigre of drag and a gender misfit, Heath-Kerr understood that often holding a mask up to society had more political impact than holding up a mirror. (Source: Trove)
